author: Marco_Dias
post_text: March 15, 2019 at 5:42 PM#1Hi,I want to clone fixture using groups, but actually want exclude group cloning by itself.[Clone Group A At Group B+C+D+E /merge /noconfirm]of course the reference group A will be updated with all the A+B+C+D+E, and this is what i want ti avoid.I want cloning everything expect groups.There is any command to filter like Cloning-GUI where you can chose "NO GROUPS"?Any clue?Thank You!

posts.author: Marco_Dias
posts.post_text: March 15, 2019 at 5:42 PM#1Hi,I want to clone fixture using groups, but actually want exclude group cloning by itself.[Clone Group A At Group B+C+D+E /merge /noconfirm]of course the reference group A will be updated with all the A+B+C+D+E, and this is what i want ti avoid.I want cloning everything expect groups.There is any command to filter like Cloning-GUI where you can chose "NO GROUPS"?Any clue?Thank You!

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: March 16, 2019 at 11:33 AM#2if you are not already selectively using the lock functionality, the easiest solution would probably be to lock/unlock all groupsCodeLock Group *Clone ........Unlock Group *otherwise you can do filtered cloning for all objects apart from groupsCodeClone ........ If Preset *.*Clone ........ If Sequence *etc

posts.author: Marco_Dias
posts.post_text: March 17, 2019 at 10:10 AM#3Hi,The lock function will make the trick.Thank you!MD

title: Clone Fixture
